$interpreted: Elio: (Good, this route seems pretty safe...)
Elio: (Oh no, way too many of them...should I use my power?)
Elio: (I must allow the princess to pass through here without harm. Looks like I have no other options-)
Angelia: Elio!
Naya: Elio, even though you volunteered to be the pathfinder, please realize we're right behind you! If you encounter a dangerous situation like that,
Naya: you should've called out to us to come help immediately!
Elio: I-I'm sorry... I was just trying my best to not bother the princess...
Angelia: Naya, Elio got the message. You shouldn't scold him any more.
Angelia: It's getting dark already. Let's set up camp around here and get some rest. We'll continue our journey to the Desert Bazaar tomorrow.
Angelia: Naya, did you hear what I said?
Naya: ... Yes. Understood.
Angelia: I'll take over the night shift. You go get some rest.
Elio: Princess Angelia? Wasn't it supposed to be Miss Naya who's taking over this shift for me?
Angelia: Just let her sleep a little longer.
Angelia: You too. Good work on being the bodyguard today. Did you get injured in battle?
Angelia: Why are you looking at me like that? Is there something on my face?
Elio: No... it's just that princess has always appeared to be shrewd and capable before. This is my first time seeing you act in such a considerate manner...
Angelia: Our meeting came too late. I was different before the war~
Angelia: Naya won't stay mad at me either... At worst, she'll just chew me out a little...
Elio: You mean before you fell out with Theodore and became his enemy?
Elio: Princess, what are your views on this war? Is there really no chance of reconciliation between you and Theodore?
Angelia: He pursues his goal of protecting the kingdom by intimidating others with superior military force. I want to create a kingdom that advocates peace;
Angelia: one that doesn't sacrifice the rights of anyone. Our ideals can no longer co-exist on the same path.
Elio: So, um... Theodore... he truly is a bad person...
Angelia: I don't think that's necessarily true.
Angelia: I've thought about this carefully. If uncle really desired the throne, he had more than enough opportunities to kill me in the past 20 years.
Angelia: But in the end, kidnapping was all he could muster up; and ordered for me to not be physically harmed...
Angelia: Moreover, it's not up to us to determine who's evil and who's righteous.
Angelia: Even if I end up winning this war, there's the possibility that I end up as the villain in the history books~
Elio: Are you saying... that Theodore is the good guy and princess is the bad guy?
Angelia: Different positions will always lead to different points of views. There is no absolute answer to this. You should decide for yourself.
Angelia: However, didn't think that I would say so much to you. We seem to get along pretty well~
Elio: I didn't think that I would see the considerate side of the princess as well.
Elio: By the time tomorrow arrives, princess will revert back to her old self, right?
Angelia: I believe so.
Elio: Then I would like to know a bit more about the kind and cheerful princess. If you don't mind, can we chat for a little longer?

Model.Text: (Good, this route seems pretty safe...)
(Oh no, way too many of them...should I use my power?)
(I must allow the princess to pass through here without harm. Looks like I have no other options-)
Elio!
Elio, even though you volunteered to be the pathfinder, please realize we're right behind you! If you encounter a dangerous situation like that,
you should've called out to us to come help immediately!
I-I'm sorry... I was just trying my best to not bother the princess...
Naya, Elio got the message. You shouldn't scold him any more.
It's getting dark already. Let's set up camp around here and get some rest. We'll continue our journey to the Desert Bazaar tomorrow.
Naya, did you hear what I said?
... Yes. Understood.
I'll take over the night shift. You go get some rest.
Princess Angelia? Wasn't it supposed to be Miss Naya who's taking over this shift for me?
Just let her sleep a little longer.
You too. Good work on being the bodyguard today. Did you get injured in battle?
Why are you looking at me like that? Is there something on my face?
No... it's just that princess has always appeared to be shrewd and capable before. This is my first time seeing you act in such a considerate manner...
Our meeting came too late. I was different before the war~
Naya won't stay mad at me either... At worst, she'll just chew me out a little...
You mean before you fell out with Theodore and became his enemy?
Princess, what are your views on this war? Is there really no chance of reconciliation between you and Theodore?
He pursues his goal of protecting the kingdom by intimidating others with superior military force. I want to create a kingdom that advocates peace;
one that doesn't sacrifice the rights of anyone. Our ideals can no longer co-exist on the same path.
So, um... Theodore... he truly is a bad person...
I don't think that's necessarily true.
I've thought about this carefully. If uncle really desired the throne, he had more than enough opportunities to kill me in the past 20 years.
But in the end, kidnapping was all he could muster up; and ordered for me to not be physically harmed...
Moreover, it's not up to us to determine who's evil and who's righteous.
Even if I end up winning this war, there's the possibility that I end up as the villain in the history books~
Are you saying... that Theodore is the good guy and princess is the bad guy?
Different positions will always lead to different points of views. There is no absolute answer to this. You should decide for yourself.
However, didn't think that I would say so much to you. We seem to get along pretty well~
I didn't think that I would see the considerate side of the princess as well.
By the time tomorrow arrives, princess will revert back to her old self, right?
I believe so.
Then I would like to know a bit more about the kind and cheerful princess. If you don't mind, can we chat for a little longer?
